alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 06 at 7:32PM EDT until August 06 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Montgomery County in east central Kentucky... Northwestern Powell County in east central Kentucky... * Until 1030 PM EDT. * At 732 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Stanton, Jeffersonville, Clay City, Waltersville, Bean, Powell Valley, Virden, Rosslyn, Westbend and Cat Creek. This includes the following streams and drainages... Lower Cane Creek, Hog Creek, Morris Creek, Red River, Lulbegrud Creek, Brush Creek, Hardwick Creek, Cane Creek, Martin Fork, South Fork Upper Spruce Creek, Camp Branch, North Branch Lulbegrud Creek, Black Creek, Slate Creek, Ficklin Fork, Cooperas Creek, Paint Creek, Plum Branch, Hatcher Creek, Bowling Fork, Spruce Creek, Middle Fork Right Fork Cane Creek and Judy Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
